newsitem.title: USA: New US corporate deals well-bid in secondary mart.
newsitem.headline: New US corporate deals well-bid in secondary mart.

text.p: There was solid demand from investors for new corporate bond issues, in an otherwise quiet day of trading in the secondary market on Friday, traders said.
Traders said this may be a sign of growing confidence in the U.S. corporate bond market.

Traders said new issues such as Comcast Cable Communications Inc's $1.7 billion four-tranche deal, KSL Recreation Group Inc's $125 million in notes and L-3 Communications Inc $225 million in notes, traded at par or higher on Friday.
Prices in the broader investment-grade and high-yield corporate bond market remained largely unchanged, they said.
